newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper ends weaker in dull, holiday trading.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper ends weaker in dull, holiday trading.

text.p: COMEX copper ended weaker in listless holiday week trading as the market barely strayed beyond a cent range in thin volume.
Traders noted that Tuesday was also expected to be quiet with LME and COMEX closing early ahead of Christmas Day.
Both exchanges are shut Wednesday, and LME will also be closed Thursday.
Rich Hirsch of Deutsche Morgan Grenfell said although March COMEX closed almost on the low, trading was featureless.
Traders expected a small hike in LME stocks Tuesday. There is no LME stock report Friday.
March COMEX settled 0.85 cent lower at 98.55 cents per pound, traded 99.60 to 98.50 cents. Spot December went out 1.30 cents weaker at 101.30 cents.
LME cash premium over three months or backwardation eased a touch to slip just below $100 by close of COMEX trade Monday.
